news_header: Russia and North Korea have formed a strategic partnership, while Russia and Iran have signed a treaty for closer cooperation.
news_text: This year, Russia and North Korea signed a strategic partnership agreement that includes mutual defense. Additionally, Russia and Iran have signed a treaty to enhance cooperation. Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov emphasized that this partnership will significantly strengthen relations between Russia and Iran. Recently, North Korea has sent approximately 10,000 troops to Russia for the Ukrainian War, which Russia has not denied. Concerns about military relations between Russia and Iran have arisen in the West, especially with ongoing conflicts involving Ukraine and missile exchanges between Iran and Israel. The U.S. has accused Iran of supplying ballistic missiles to Russia for use in Ukraine.
